verses.verse: At this <S%H2063><s%> also <S%H637><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%> trembleth, <S%H2729><s%> and is moved <S%H5425><s%> out of his place. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H4725><s%>
Hear attentively <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8085><s%> the noise <S%H7267><s%> of his voice, <S%H6963><s%> and the sound <S%H1899><s%> that goeth out <S%H3318><s%> of his mouth. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6310><s%>
He directeth <S%H3474><s%> it under <S%H8478><s%> the whole <S%H3605><s%> heaven, <S%H8064><s%> and his lightning <S%H216><s%> unto <S%H5921><s%> the ends <S%H3671><s%> of the earth. <S%H776><s%>

After <S%H310><s%> it a voice <S%H6963><s%> roareth: <S%H7580><s%> he thundereth <S%H7481><s%> with the voice <S%H6963><s%> of his excellency; <S%H1347><s%> and he will not <S%H3808><s%> stay <S%H6117><s%> them when <S%H3588><s%> his voice <S%H6963><s%> is heard. <S%H8085><s%>

God <S%H410><s%> thundereth <S%H7481><s%> marvelously <S%H6381><s%> with his voice; <S%H6963><s%> great things <S%H1419><s%> doeth <S%H6213><s%> he, which we cannot <S%H3808><s%> comprehend. <S%H3045><s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> he saith <S%H559><s%> to the snow, <S%H7950><s%> Be <S%H1933><s%> thou on the earth; <S%H776><s%> likewise to the small <S%H4306><s%> rain, <S%H1653><s%> and to the great <S%H4306><s%> rain <S%H1653><s%> of his strength. <S%H5797><s%>
He sealeth up <S%H2856><s%> the hand <S%H3027><s%> of every <S%H3605><s%> man; <S%H120><s%> that all <S%H3605><s%> men <S%H376><s%> may know <S%H3045><s%> his work. <S%H4639><s%>
Then the beasts <S%H2416><s%> go <S%H935><s%> into <S%H1119><s%> dens, <S%H695><s%> and remain <S%H7931><s%> in their places. <S%H4585><s%>
Out of <S%H4480><s%> the south <S%H2315><s%> cometh <S%H935><s%> the whirlwind: <S%H5492><s%> and cold <S%H7135><s%> out of the north. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H4215><s%>
By the breath <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5397><s%> of God <S%H410><s%> frost <S%H7140><s%> is given: <S%H5414><s%> and the breadth <S%H7341><s%> of the waters <S%H4325><s%> is straitened. <S%H4164><s%>
Also <S%H637><s%> by watering <S%H7377><s%> he wearieth <S%H2959><s%> the thick cloud: <S%H5645><s%> he scattereth <S%H6327><s%> his bright <S%H216><s%> cloud: <S%H6051><s%>

And it <S%H1931><s%> is turned <S%H2015><s%> round about <S%H4524><s%> by his counsels: <S%H8458><s%> that they may do <S%H6466><s%> whatsoever <S%H3605><s%> <S%H834><s%> he commandeth <S%H6680><s%> them upon <S%H5921><s%> the face <S%H6440><s%> of the world <S%H8398><s%> in the earth. <S%H776><s%>
He causeth it to come, <S%H4672><s%> whether <S%H518><s%> for correction, <S%H7626><s%> or <S%H518><s%> for his land, <S%H776><s%> or <S%H518><s%> for mercy. <S%H2617><s%>
Hearken <S%H238><s%> unto this, <S%H2063><s%> O Job: <S%H347><s%> stand still, <S%H5975><s%> and consider <S%H995><s%> the wondrous <S%H6381><s%> works of God. <S%H410><s%>
Dost thou know <S%H3045><s%> when God <S%H433><s%> disposed <S%H7760><s%> <S%H5921><s%> them, and caused the light <S%H216><s%> of his cloud <S%H6051><s%> to shine? <S%H3313><s%>
Dost thou know <S%H3045><s%> <S%H5921><s%> the balancings <S%H4657><s%> of the clouds, <S%H5645><s%> the wondrous works <S%H4652><s%> of him which is perfect <S%H8549><s%> in knowledge? <S%H1843><s%>
How <S%H834><s%> thy garments <S%H899><s%> are warm, <S%H2525><s%> when he quieteth <S%H8252><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> by the south <S%H4480><s%> <S%H1864><s%> wind?
Hast thou with <S%H5973><s%> him spread out <S%H7554><s%> the sky, <S%H7834><s%> which is strong, <S%H2389><s%> and as a molten <S%H3332><s%> looking glass? <S%H7209><s%>

Teach <S%H3045><s%> us what <S%H4100><s%> we shall say <S%H559><s%> unto him; for we cannot <S%H3808><s%> order <S%H6186><s%> our speech by reason <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6440><s%> of darkness. <S%H2822><s%>
Shall it be told <S%H5608><s%> him that <S%H3588><s%> I speak? <S%H1696><s%> if <S%H518><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> speak, <S%H559><s%> surely <S%H3588><s%> he shall be swallowed up. <S%H1104><s%>

And now <S%H6258><s%> men see <S%H7200><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> the bright <S%H925><s%> light <S%H216><s%> which <S%H1931><s%> is in the clouds: <S%H7834><s%> but the wind <S%H7307><s%> passeth, <S%H5674><s%> and cleanseth <S%H2891><s%> them.
Fair weather <S%H2091><s%> cometh <S%H857><s%> out of the north: <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6828><s%> with <S%H5921><s%> God <S%H433><s%> is terrible <S%H3372><s%> majesty. <S%H1935><s%>

Touching the Almighty, <S%H7706><s%> we cannot <S%H3808><s%> find him out: <S%H4672><s%> he is excellent <S%H7689><s%> in power, <S%H3581><s%> and in judgment, <S%H4941><s%> and in plenty <S%H7230><s%> of justice: <S%H6666><s%> he will not <S%H3808><s%> afflict. <S%H6031><s%>
Men <S%H376><s%> do therefore <S%H3651><s%> fear <S%H3372><s%> him: he respecteth <S%H7200><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> any <S%H3605><s%> that are wise <S%H2450><s%> of heart. <S%H3820><s%>
